Question: What is Redis
Answer: Redis stands for Remote Dictionary Server it is an open source in-memory NoSQL key value store primarily used as a cache or a fast response database

Question: Why is Redis considered so fast
Answer: Because it stores and serves data entirely from RAM rather than from a disk or SSD

Question: What kind of data can i actually store in Redis is it just strings
Answer: No besides strings you have lists hashes sets and sorted sets

Question: How do I see how much memory Redis is currently using
Answer: You can use the info memory command it gives a detailed breakdown of used memory peak memory and fragmentation

Question: Can I store a negative value in Redis
Answer: Yes absolutely

Question: What is the difference between sismember and smembers
Answer: sismember checks if a specific value exists in a set while smembers returns every single item in that set

Question: What if I want to append text to an existing string key
Answer: There is an append command it adds the value to the end of the current string and returns the new total length

Question: What is the type command used for
Answer: It tells you the data structure of the key whether it is a string list set zset or hash

Question: Does Redis support IPv6
Answer: Yes since version 2.8

Question: How do you stop a running Redis server
Answer: Using the command shutdown It saves the data to disk before closing

Question: Can you set multiple TTLs on one key
Answer: No only one TTL per key

Question: How do you see the uptime of the server
Answer: Under the info server section

Question: Is it possible to undo a flushall
Answer: No once its gone its gone unless you have a backup RDB file

Question: What is lindex
Answer: It gets an element from a list by its index

Question: Can I use Redis on a Raspberry Pi
Answer: Yes it’s very lightweight and runs great on small ARM devices

Question: Is Redis single threaded
Answer: Yes the core execution is single-threaded to avoid locking overhead

Question: Is there a way to increment a value inside a Hash
Answer: Yes using hincrby

Question: Lets say I want to store a User object with a name email and age which data type is best
Answer: A hash would be perfect for that It allows you to store multiple field value pairs under a single key which is very memory efficient

Question: What if I have a list of tasks and I want to add a new task to the very beginning
Answer: You would use LPUSH It adds the element to the head of the list

Question: And if I want to get that task and remove it at the same time
Answer: use LPOP to take it from the beginning or RPOP if treating the list like a queue

Question: What is the main difference between a Set and a List
Answer: Lists are ordered and allow duplicate values sets are unordered and automatically handle uniqueness you can't have the same member twice

Question: Can you explain what Pipelining is
Answer: Pipelining is when the client sends a batch of commands to the server all at once without waiting for the replies in between It saves a lot of time by reducing network round trips

Question: What happens if i try to add a member to a set that’s already there
Answer: The SADD command will simply return 0 and nothing changes because Sets only store unique members

Question: What is a cache miss
Answer: when the application looks for data in Redis but it is not there the app then has to go to the slower primary database to fetch it

Question: Suppose i want to find the intersection of two sets is there a command for that
Answer: Yes SINTER it is very useful for things like finding common friends between two users

Question: Is there a way to increment a value inside a Hash
Answer: Yes using HINCRBY

Question: If i am using RDB can i lose data
Answer: Yes since RDB saves at intervals if the server crashes between saves you lose everything since the last snapshot

Question: Then why use RDB at all
Answer: It is great for backups it is a single compact file that you can easily move to s3 or another server for disaster recovery

Question: What is the MONITOR command and when should you use it
Answer: It shows every single command the server is processing in real time it is great for debugging but terrible for performance so i had never leave it running in production

Question: How do you secure a Redis instance
Answer: First i would bind it to localhost or a private VPC then i would enable a strong password using requirepass and rename dangerous commands like FLUSHALL

Question: If i have 100 Sentinels and 1 master is that a good setup
Answer: Usually 3 or 5 Sentinels are enough you just need an odd number to reach a Quorum for voting

Question: How do you rename a key safely
Answer: I would use RENAME if i want to ensure i dont overwrite an existing key i would use RENAMENX

Question: Redis vs Memcached why choose Redis
Answer: Redis has data structures persistence and replication but Memcached is just a simple string cache

Question: What is the complexity of getting a value from a Hash
Answer: It is O(1)

Question: Explain the difference between RDB and AOF persistence and which one would you choose
Answer: RDB takes snapshots at intervals while AOF logs every single write command I would usually use both AOF for better data safety and RDB for faster backups and restarts

Question: If my Redis instance is running out of memory what does it do
Answer: It follows an Eviction Policy for example with LRU it will delete the oldest least used keys to make room for new ones

Question: Is Redis replication synchronous
Answer: No it is asynchronous the master returns success to the client after writing locally and then propagates the data to replicas in the background

Question: How does AOF handle a situation where the disk is full and the log gets corrupted
Answer: Redis provides a tool called redis check aof that can fix the file by removing the partially written command at the end

Question: Explain the SCAN command Why is it better than KEYS *
Answer: KEYS * blocks the entire server until it finishes scanning SCAN uses a cursor to give you the keys in small batches so the server stays responsive

Question: If I delete a million keys at once using a script what happens
Answer: The server might freeze for a few seconds to avoid this I would  use a script to delete them in smaller batches or use the UNLINK command

Question: Can I set an expiration for a single field inside a Hash
Answer: No Redis only supports expiration for the entire key if you need field level expiration you would have to manage that logic in your application code

Question: What is Object Sharing in Redis
Answer: To save memory Redis shares small integer objects internally so it doesnt have to create a new object every time

Question: What is Client side Caching in Redis 6
Answer: It is a feature where Redis notifies the application when a key has changed so the application can safely keep a local copy of the data

Question: How do you handle Hot Keys
Answer: If one key is getting millions of hits i might create replicas of that key  or use a local cache in the app layer to reduce the load on Redis

Question: What is Redis Serialization Protocol
Answer: It is the simple text-based protocol that Redis clients use to talk to the Redis server

Question: What is a Bloom Filter and why use it with Redis
Answer: It is a space efficient way to check if an item might exist we use it to prevent Cache Penetration by filtering out requests for ids that definitely arent in our database

Question: What is a Dirty Key in AOF
Answer: It is a key that has been modified in memory but not yet synced to the AOF file on disk

Question: What is a Stream in Redis
Answer: A data structure for append only logs it is great for event sourcing or building a message bus with consumer groups

Question: How does Redis handle expiration internally
Answer: Two ways passive when the key is accessed and active it periodically tests random keys and deletes expired ones

Question: Does Redis support ACID transactions
Answer: Partially it supports atomicity and isolation but not full durability in the way a sql database does

Question: What is a Redis Module
Answer: A dynamic library that you can load into Redis to add new data types or features like RedisJSON or RedisGraph

Question: Finally why should we hire you as a Redis expert
Answer: Because i understand not just how to use the commands but how Redis manages memory persistence and scaling to build high performance systems
